Building a blog website

TL;DR

Build a blog website, with "bare hands"---no WordPress-like content management system, no static site generator. Write content in plain text, do custom conversion to HTML, deploy to GitHub Pages with self-defined workflow. Everything is done in a simple, straightforward and transparent way.

Method

  1. The folder organization
  2. The markup converter
  3. The deployment flow

Folder Structure

madpang.github.io
|- content
|  |- a-single-post
|  |  |- post-text.txt
|  |  |- media/
|- artifact
|  |- a-single-post
|  |  |- post-text.html
|  |  |- media/
|- index.html

The `artifact/a-single-post` folder is the output of the conversion process.

Background

I want maximal control on page design, content organization, and deployment process, so I do not want to rely on any easy-to-use but actually overly complicated templates from CMS provider or static site generator. For example, I have used Jekyll and Hugo, but I have to obey their rules on how to organize contents, which I find uncomfortable.

I even find the Markdown format somewhat restrictive---I would like to bend it a little bit to suit my needs. So I implement my own converter.

To the core, I desire maximal freedom on creation.
